#summary Physical RAM Map

The top part of the RAM will be mapped to various places in virtual memory using the MMU lookup table.

Physical Map
|| `04000000` || 1st level MMU table (16kB) ||
|| `04004000` || RAM ||
|| `043c0000`<br>'043fffff` || Video RAM: 320x480/2=76800 bytes ||

Virtual Map (no details yet, must verify the addresses and ranges!). Still missing is the Serial Number ROM (may be i2c?), DMA, Interrup registers, etc. .
|| `01b00000` || Jump Table ||
|| `04000000` || 1st level MMU table (16kB) ||
|| `043c0000` || Video RAM: 320x480/2=76800 bytes ||
|| `0C100000` || System Variables ||
|| `0f180000` || GPIO, General Purpose I/O ||
